data.name: Deep Arithmetic
data.description:
Write a function that takes an array of strings of arbitrary dimensions (`[], [[]], [[[]]]`, etc.) and arbitary length and returns the sum of every separate number in each string in the array.

```
sum(["1", "five", "2wenty", "thr33"])                          --->>> 36

sum([["1X2", "t3n"],["1024", "5", "64"]])                      --->>> 1099

sum([[["1"], "10v3"], ["738h"], [["s0"], ["1mu4ch3"],"-1s0"]]) --->>> 759

```

# Note : 

---

1. Numbers in strings can be negative, but will all be base-10 integers.
2. Negative numbers may directly follow another number.
3. The hyphen or minus character ("-") does not only occur in numbers.
4. Arrays may be ragged or empty.
